intro: Hedysarum damghanicum, commonly known as Damghan sweet clover, is a perennial leguminous plant native to central Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a robust root system that helps in soil stabilization and nitrogen fixation. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in steppe and semi-desert environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
